items.prompt: Create an account plan for [customer name]. Use these inputs: company profile, known priorities, current product usage, stakeholders, and renewal date. Output a structured plan with goals, risks, opportunities, and next steps.
items.superPrompt: Create an account plan for {{ field1 || customer name}}. Use these inputs: company profile, known priorities, current product usage, stakeholders, and renewal date. Output a structured plan with goals, risks, opportunities, and next steps.

items.prompt: Create a territory planning guide for our next fiscal year. Inputs: team headcount, target industries, regions, and historical revenue. Recommend allocation method and sample coverage plan.
items.superPrompt: Create a territory planning guide for our next fiscal year. Inputs: team headcount, target industries, regions, and historical revenue. Recommend allocation method and sample coverage plan.

items.prompt: I have this list of accounts: [paste sample]. Prioritize them based on [criteria: industry, size, funding, tech stack]. Output a ranked list with reasons why.
items.superPrompt: I have this list of accounts: {{ field1 || paste sample}}. Prioritize them based on {{ field2 || criteria: industry, size, funding, tech stack}}. Output a ranked list with reasons why.

items.use_case: Spot high-potential accounts using weighted scoring
items.prompt: Score accounts based on [insert rules—e.g., company size, engagement score, intent signals]. Data: [Upload account list]. Output top 10 ranked accounts with their score and a note explaining why.
items.superPrompt: Score accounts based on {{ field1 || insert rules—e.g., company size, engagement score, intent signals}}. Data: {{ field2 || Upload account list}}. Output top 10 ranked accounts with their score and a note explaining why.

items.prompt: I’m evaluating market entry into [region/country] for our [SaaS solution]. Research local buying behaviors, competitive landscape, economic conditions, and regulatory concerns. Format as a go/no-go market readiness summary with citations and action steps.
items.superPrompt: I’m evaluating market entry into {{ field1 || region/country}} for our {{ field2 || SaaS solution}}. Research local buying behaviors, competitive landscape, economic conditions, and regulatory concerns. Format as a go/no-go market readiness summary with citations and action steps.

items.prompt: Create a battlecard for [competitor name]. Use these notes: [insert positioning data]. Include strengths, weaknesses, how we win, and quick talk track. Output as table format.
items.superPrompt: Create a battlecard for {{ field1 || competitor name}}. Use these notes: {{ field2 || insert positioning data}}. Include strengths, weaknesses, how we win, and quick talk track. Output as table format.

items.prompt: I’m preparing a competitive battlecard for [competitor name]. Research their pricing model, product positioning, recent customer wins/losses, and sales motion. Compare it to ours based on these strengths: [insert]. Output a 1-page summary with citations.
items.superPrompt: I’m preparing a competitive battlecard for {{ field1 || competitor name}}. Research their pricing model, product positioning, recent customer wins/losses, and sales motion. Compare it to ours based on these strengths: {{ field2 || insert}}. Output a 1-page summary with citations.

items.prompt: Create a one-pager to help reps pitch [product name] to [persona]. Include key benefits, features, common use cases, and competitor differentiators. Format as copy-ready enablement doc.
items.superPrompt: Create a one-pager to help reps pitch {{ field1 || product name}} to {{ field2 || persona}}. Include key benefits, features, common use cases, and competitor differentiators. Format as copy-ready enablement doc.

items.prompt: Create rebuttals to these common objections: [insert 2–3 objections]. Make them sound natural and confident, and include a backup stat or story where useful. Output as list.
items.superPrompt: Create rebuttals to these common objections: {{ field1 || insert 2–3 objections}}. Make them sound natural and confident, and include a backup stat or story where useful. Output as list.

items.use_case: Find customer proof points in the public domain
items.prompt: Research recent online reviews, social mentions, and testimonials about [our product OR competitor product]. Focus on what customers are praising or criticizing. Summarize top 5 quotes, what persona each came from, and where it was posted. Include links.
items.superPrompt: Research recent online reviews, social mentions, and testimonials about {{ field1 || our product OR competitor product}}. Focus on what customers are praising or criticizing. Summarize top 5 quotes, what persona each came from, and where it was posted. Include links.

items.use_case: Analyze pipeline conversion rates by stage
items.prompt: Analyze this sales pipeline export. Calculate conversion rates between each stage and identify the biggest drop-off point. Data: [Upload pipeline CSV]. Output a short summary and a table of conversion % by stage.
items.superPrompt: Analyze this sales pipeline export. Calculate conversion rates between each stage and identify the biggest drop-off point. Data: {{ field1 || Upload pipeline CSV}}. Output a short summary and a table of conversion % by stage.

items.use_case: Identify top-performing reps by close rate
items.prompt: From this dataset of rep activities and closed deals, calculate the close rate for each rep and rank them. Data: [Upload rep performance CSV]. Output a ranked list and a sentence for each rep’s strength.
items.superPrompt: From this dataset of rep activities and closed deals, calculate the close rate for each rep and rank them. Data: {{ field1 || Upload rep performance CSV}}. Output a ranked list and a sentence for each rep’s strength.

items.prompt: Use this CRM export to calculate average deal velocity per quarter (days from lead to close). Data: [Upload with open/close dates]. Show velocity trend in a simple chart and summarize the trendline.
items.superPrompt: Use this CRM export to calculate average deal velocity per quarter (days from lead to close). Data: {{ field1 || Upload with open/close dates}}. Show velocity trend in a simple chart and summarize the trendline.

items.use_case: Summarize campaign attribution to closed deals
items.prompt: Match campaign sources to closed-won deals from this data. Identify which campaign drove the most closed revenue. Data: [Upload campaign + deal export]. Output a ranked list and a short campaign summary.
items.superPrompt: Match campaign sources to closed-won deals from this data. Identify which campaign drove the most closed revenue. Data: {{ field1 || Upload campaign + deal export}}. Output a ranked list and a short campaign summary.

items.prompt: Here’s a table of rep performance by quarter: [paste data]. Compare top vs bottom performers. Show chart with trends and call out key differences. Output as table + insights.
items.superPrompt: Here’s a table of rep performance by quarter: {{ field1 || paste data}}. Compare top vs bottom performers. Show chart with trends and call out key differences. Output as table + insights.

items.use_case: Visualize sales process in funnel view
items.prompt: Create a funnel graphic showing our sales stages: [insert stages]. Make it clean and easy to read for onboarding docs. Output as simple image.
items.superPrompt: Create a funnel graphic showing our sales stages: {{ field1 || insert stages}}. Make it clean and easy to read for onboarding docs. Output as simple image.

items.prompt: Create an image of a standard B2B SaaS sales funnel with these stages: Prospecting, Discovery, Demo, Proposal, Closed Won/Lost. Use clean, modern icons and text labels. Output should be clear enough for use in a slide or enablement doc.
items.superPrompt: Create an image of a standard B2B SaaS sales funnel with these stages: Prospecting, Discovery, Demo, Proposal, Closed Won/Lost. Use clean, modern icons and text labels. Output should be clear enough for use in a slide or enablement doc.

items.prompt: Create professional illustrations for 3 personas: (1) CFO of a mid-market company, (2) VP of IT at a global enterprise, and (3) Operations Manager at a logistics firm. Style should be flat and modern, ideal for use in a one-pager or training slide.
items.superPrompt: Create professional illustrations for 3 personas: (1) CFO of a mid-market company, (2) VP of IT at a global enterprise, and (3) Operations Manager at a logistics firm. Style should be flat and modern, ideal for use in a one-pager or training slide.

items.prompt: Create a simplified U.S. map showing sales territories split by region: West, Central, East. Use distinctive color zones and label key states. Output should look clean and suitable for a sales kickoff deck.
items.superPrompt: Create a simplified U.S. map showing sales territories split by region: West, Central, East. Use distinctive color zones and label key states. Output should look clean and suitable for a sales kickoff deck.

items.prompt: Design a fun, modern graphic to celebrate “Top Rep of the Month.” Include a placeholder for name/photo and stylized trophy or badge. Style should match internal brand or newsletter vibe.
items.superPrompt: Design a fun, modern graphic to celebrate “Top Rep of the Month.” Include a placeholder for name/photo and stylized trophy or badge. Style should match internal brand or newsletter vibe.
